One Line Release Note Description: The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler now supports drawing metrics throug the API server aggregator.

Features: Arbitrary/Custom Metrics in the Horizontal Pod Autoscaler
One Line Release Note Description: The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler now supports scaling on multiple, custom metrics.

Features: Integrate Cluster Bootstrap/Discovery with Kubenetes Core
One Line Release Note Description: New Bootstrap Token authentication and management method. Works well with kubeadm.

Features: Support out-of-process and out-of-tree cloud providers
One Line Release Note Description: Adds a new cloud-controller-manager binary that may be used for testing the new out-of-core cloudprovider flow

Features: Represent node problems using NoExecute taint, and allow user-defined eviction time threshold using tolerationSeconds
One Line Release Note Description: Per-pod configurable duration to stay bound to a node that becomes unreachable, not ready, or has other problems
Adds a new API resource `PodPreset` and admission controller to enable defining cross-cutting injection of Volumes and Environment into Pods.
A new volume driver capable of projecting secrets, configmaps, and downward API items into the same directory.

Features: Flex volume API and Improved lifecycle (flexvolume)
One Line Release Note Description: Flex volume plugin is updated to support attach/detach interfaces. It broke backward compatibility. Please update your drivers and implement the new callouts.
Implement the update feature for DaemonSet.

Features: Allow deployments to correctly indicate they are failing to deploy
One Line Release Note Description: Deployments that cannot make progress in rolling out the newest version will now indicate via the API they are blocked
RBAC API is promoted to v1beta1 (rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1), and defines default roles for control plane, node, and controller components.
Introduces an API for the Kubelet to request TLS certificates from the API server.
kubeadm is enhanced and improved with a baseline feature set and command line flags that are now marked as beta.

Features: It should be fast and painless to deploy a Federation of Kubernetes clusters
One Line Release Note Description: `kubefed` has graduated to beta: supports hosting federation on on-prem clusters, automatically configures `kube-dns` in joining clusters and allows passing arguments to federation components.
The Docker-CRI implementation is Beta and is enabled by default in kubelet.  You can disable it by --enable-cri=false.
Rules for spreading and packing pods relative to one another, within arbitrary topologies (node, zone, etc.)
Rules for restricting which node(s) a pod can schedule onto
User can run multiple schedulers in parallel resposible for different sets of pods
Rules for "repelling" pods from nodes by default (support use cases like dedicated nodes, and reserve nodes with special features for pods that need those features)
Added support for mount options in persistent volumes

Features: etcd v3 as storage backend for APIServer
One Line Release Note Description: The internal storage layer for kubernetes cluster state has been updated to use etcd v3 by default for new clusters.  Old clusters will have to plan for a data migration window.

Features: Add support for pod and qos level cgroups
One Line Release Note Description: kubelet launches pods in a new cgroup hierarchy to better enforce quality of service.  Operators must drain all pods from their nodes prior to upgrade of the kubelet.  They must ensure the configured cgroup driver matches their associated container runtime cgroup driver.
Notes: this feature requires that operators drain their nodes prior to upgrade of the kubelet

One Line Release Note Description: StorageClass API is promoted to v1 (storage.k8s.io/v1)

Features: Default Storage Classes for Cloud Providers
One Line Release Note Description: Default storage classes are deployed during installation on Azure, AWS, GCE, OpenStack and vSphere

Features: Create environment variables from all keys in a Secret/Configmap
One Line Release Note Description: Populate environment variables from a configmap or secret.
Support for user-written/run dynamic PV provisioners. See github.com/kubernetes-incubator/external-storage for a golang library and examples
ScaleIO Kubernetes Volume Plugin added enabling pods to seamlessly access and use data stored on ScaleIO volumes.

Portworx Volume Plugin added capability to use [Portworx](http://www.portworx.com) as a storage provider for Kubernetes clusters. Portworx pools your servers capacity and turns your servers or cloud instances into converged, highly available compute and storage nodes.

Features: Customized mounts in chroot to GA
One Line Release Note Description: Add support to use NFSv3, NFSv4, and GlusterFS on GCI image cluster
